intro: Hieracium prenanthoides subsp. subelatifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is an herbaceous perennial that can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
